title: Web Application Security
description: Test your knowledge of web application security concepts, vulnerabilities, and best practices. This quiz covers common web attacks, secure coding practices, and defense mechanisms.

answers.text: A vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users
A technique to speed up website loading
A method to secure communication between websites
A type of encryption for web traffic
A technique to optimize database queries
A vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious SQL code into database queries
A method to secure database connections
A type of database management system
A technique to optimize website performance
A method to secure communication between websites
A vulnerability that allows attackers to trick users into performing unwanted actions on a website they're authenticated to
A type of encryption for web traffic

questions.text: What is the purpose of Content Security Policy (CSP)?

answers.text: To optimize website loading speed
To restrict which resources can be loaded by a web page, helping prevent XSS and data injection attacks
To encrypt all web traffic
To manage user authentication
A security mechanism that restricts how a document or script from one origin can interact with resources from another origin
A policy that requires all websites to use the same programming language
A technique to optimize website performance
A method to secure database connections
A programming language for web development
A type of web server
HTTP with an added security layer using SSL/TLS
A database management system

questions.text: What is the purpose of OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project)?

answers.text: To develop web applications
To provide free and open resources for improving web application security
To sell security products
To host websites securely
A technique to optimize website performance
A process of ensuring that user input meets certain criteria before processing it
A method to encrypt user data
A type of authentication mechanism

questions.text: What is the principle of least privilege in web security?

answers.text: Giving users the minimum level of access or permissions needed to perform their job functions
Restricting access to all users equally
Providing maximum access to administrators
Allowing all users to access all features

questions.text: What is a Web Application Firewall (WAF)?

answers.text: A tool to develop web applications faster
A security solution that filters and monitors HTTP traffic between a web application and the Internet
A type of web server
A programming language for web development
